description.narrative: 7.2. By 2021, the Government has enhanced capacity, improved systems, and evidence for child sensitive public finance and development planning at national and subnational levels.

sector.narrative: Building evaluation capacity in UNICEF and the UN system
Building research capacity in UNICEF and the UN system
Child poverty analysis towards policy change (Profiling, mapping and identifying drivers of multi-dimensional and monetary poverty of children, modelling and simulation of policy options)
Child poverty measurement: support to routine national measurement of monetary and multidimensional child poverty

Contributing to policies reducing child poverty: Poverty reduction strategies, national development plans, engagement with ministries, parliament, international donor and financial organizations, civil society organizations)
PF4C: Budget transparency, accountability and participation
PF4C: Improving public expenditure effectiveness / efficiency

description.narrative: Development Partner affairs Technical staff services
Social Protection, Land Housing and Community Amenities social services (incl youth development and women+ children)

title.narrative: Zambia United Nations Development Assistance Framework
UNICEF Programmes in Zambia (Social Policy Research)
UNICEF Contract Awards through the UN Global Marketplace
"2019 Zambia: Outcome evaluation of the investment in institutional community and individual capacity development"
Zambia 2019 Annual Report on Results for Children
Zambia Country Office 2020 Annual Report on Results for Children

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: 7.2. By 2021, the Government has enhanced capacity, improved systems, and evidence for child sensitive public finance and development planning at national and subnational levels.

description.narrative: UNICEF supported quarterly in-year budget analysis (in-year budget tracking), as well as conducted analyses and prepared budget briefs for the social sectors (social protection, WASH, health, and education) for 2020, as well as initiating public expenditure reviews in health and social protection sectors, and finalisation of the Open Budget Survey and the implementation of the OBS recommendations. These analyses have helped with advocacy efforts to not only improve allocations to key social sectors, but also to spotlight the declining disbursements to social sectors (weak budget execution). | Status:On-track | As-of Date:30/06/2020

title.narrative: 3.1 Citizens (including children) empowered to participate in (sub)national budget process to improve budget transparency and accountability
Governemnt budget allocations to sectoral or child-focused policies and programs as percentage of total government budget allocations
Monetary child poverty is routinely measured and reported by the government
National budgets and social sector investments are routinely monitored

actual.value: 2018:Drafts available. awaiting for the approved budget to be public

title.narrative: 3.2 Evidence generated on budgets and their linkages to child outcomes to improve budget allocations/expenditure for children
Multidimensional child poverty is routinely measured and reported by the government
